summary: 03/01/1993: A car bomb, containing 450 pounds of explosives, blew up outside an air-force recruiting station. The blast killed two and injured 54. The bomb cracked a 12-foot-high wall around the compound and broke several windows. Police said the Shining Path (Sendero Luminoso) was responsible for the attack.
weapdetail: A car bomb containing 450 pounds of explosives.
propcomment: The bomb cracked a 12-foot-high wall around the compound and broke several windows.
scite1: Center for Terrorism and Intelligence Studies, Critical Infrastructure Terrorist Attack Database, San Jose, CA: Akribis Group, July 7 2006.
